boardgame.name: Spielkartenset Aventurisches Animatorium
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb

This deck of playing cards contains all the values for golems, homunculi, and automata from the Aventurian Animatorium. In addition, reference cards clearly present all the associated rules surrounding the creation, animation, care, control, and combat of animated construct creatures. All special skills, spells, tools and profession packs for golem builders, homunculus chimists and automaton tinkerers are also included.


Klappentext

Dieses Spielkartenset enthält alle Werte für Golems, Homunculi und Automaten aus dem Aventurischen Animatorium. Zusätzlich präsentieren Referenzkarten übersichtlich alle zugehörigen Regeln rund um Herstellung, Belebung, Pflege, Kontrolle und Kampf von animierten Konstruktwesen. Auch alle Sonderfertigkeiten, Zauber, Hilfsmittel und Professionspakete für Golembauer, Homunculusalchimisten und Automatentüftler sind enthalten.

boardgame.name: Spielkartenset Die Gestade des Gottwals II
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb

On the sea-swept shores of the Godwhale, brave sailors, spell-casting animal warriors, and other heroes face sinister horrors from night-black depths and days long past that make the already harsh life in the far north a true challenge. This deck of playing cards contains all the special skills, spells, rituals, animist powers, spell runes, liturgies, ceremonies, and other useful content from Ghost Forest & Bone Cliffs, Storm Howl & Rune Spells, Faith, Might & Heroism - The Shores of the Godwhale, and Doom Oath & Scaldensong, including several new tradition artifacts and ceremonial items such as the Claw Necklace, Ghost Fetish, and Flukamulet.


Klappentext

An den gischtumtosten Gestaden des Gottwals sehen sich tapfere Seefahrer, zaubermächtige Tierkriegerinnen und andere Helden finsteren Schrecken aus nachtschwarzen Tiefen und längst vergangenen Tagen gegenüber, die das ohnehin raue Leben im hohen Norden zu einer wahren Herausforderung werden lassen. Dieses Spielkartenset enthält alle Sonderfertigkeiten, Zauber, Rituale, Animistenkräfte, Zauberrunen, Liturgien, Zeremonien und weitere nützliche Inhalte aus Geisterwald & Knochenklippen, Sturmgeheul & Runenzauber, Glaube, Macht & Heldenmut – Die Gestade des Gottwals und Schicksalsschwur & Skaldensang, darunter auch einige neue Traditionsartefakte und Zeremonialgegenstände wie die Krallenkette, den Geisterfetisch oder das Flukenamulett.

boardgame.name: Sturmgeheul und Runenzauber
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb

Storm Howl & Runic Spells is a game aid for The Shores of the Godwhale - Thorwal & the Gjalskerlands and contains further information and additional rules for the game in Thorwal.

This game aid contains alternative curricula for the mage academies in Thorwal and Olport, the traditions of the magic dilettantes who often pursue a special craft in Thorwal, new special skills, rules for alternative weapons as banishing swords, new spell runes and spell tunes, instrument spells and with the drinking horn also a secondary tradition artifact for Sangara. For Swafnir consecrators, it offers more liturgies, liturgy enhancements, and rules for ceremonial items such as the whale shield and the new fluking amulet.

A short chapter on flora and fauna adds typical Thorwalian animal companions, more plants and elementals that can be summoned by the mages of the Hall of Winds to the regional game help.

In addition, Storm Howl & Runic Spells contains detailed descriptions and maps of the warrior and mage academies in Olport, Prem, and Thorwal.

In addition to the rulebook and the Aventurian Almanac, The Shores of the Godwhale - Thorwal & the Gjalskerland is required to use this game aid. Aventurian Magic is also required and Aventurian Magic III is recommended for the use of the rules on alternative weapons to the Bansword. For full use of the alternate curricula, Aventurian Magic I-III is recommended.


Sturmgeheul & Runenzauber ist eine Spielhilfe für Die Gestade des Gottwals – Thorwal & das Gjalskerland und beinhaltet weiterführende Informationen und zusätzliche Regeln für das Spiel in Thorwal.

Diese Spielhilfe enthält alternative Lehrpläne für die Magierakademien in Thorwal und Olport, die Traditionen der Magiedilettanten, die in Thorwal oft einem speziellen Handwerk nachgehen, neue Sonderfertigkeiten, Regeln zu alternativen Waffen als Bannschwert, neue Zauberrunen und Zaubermelodien, Instrumentenzauber und mit dem Trinkhorn auch ein sekundäres Traditionsartefakt für Sangara. Für Swafnirgeweihte bietet sie weitere Liturgien, Liturgieerweiterungen, sowie Regeln zu Zeremonialgegenständen wie dem Walschild und dem neuen Flukenamulett.

Ein kurzes Kapitel zu Flora und Fauna ergänzt die Regionalspielhilfe um typisch thorwalsche Tiergefährten, weitere Pflanzen und Elementare, die von den Magiern der Halle der Winde gerufen werden können.

Darüber hinaus enthält Sturmgeheul & Runenzauber ausführliche Beschreibungen und Kartenmaterial zu den Krieger- und Magierakademien in Olport, Prem und Thorwal.

Zur Benutzung dieser Spielhilfe wird neben dem Regelwerk und dem Aventurischen Almanach auch Die Gestade des Gottwals – Thorwal & das Gjalskerland vorausgesetzt. Für die Nutzung der Regeln zu alternativen Waffen als Bannschwert wird außerdem Aventurische Magie vorausgesetzt und Aventurische Magie III empfohlen. Für die vollumfängliche Nutzung der alternativen Lehrpläne werden Aventurische Magie I-III empfohlen.

boardgame.name: Heldenwerk-Archiv V
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb

The Heldenwerk Archive V contains seven short adventures that will keep your players busy all over the continent of Aventuria - because the work of a warrior hero is never done! For this anthology, all adventures have been supplemented with additional material and a foreword by the respective authors. Six of the seven adventures come from the Heldenwerk series, the seventh was written exclusively for the Ulisses Online Con 2021.

Featherfall deals with the fall of the stars. In classic explorer style, the goal is to uncover an old secret about forgotten deities in southern Almada.

To the core sends the heroes on a chase. An arduous journey, whose goal is retribution with hope for justice, drives them through the Rommilyser Mark.

Bloody Fur is set in the Svellt Valley. Tiefhusen has fallen. Just as the tension between the survivors is about to reach its breaking point, vital supplies of goods fail to arrive.

The Silent Path awaits with an unheard-of occurrence: A Boron devotee in a small Horasian coastal town breaks her vow of silence a hundredfold, and for seemingly no reason!

Mada's Blue Eyes, a solo adventure, leads into an ancient temple of elemental power. Through Sultan Hasrabal's eyes, years of research by the consummate magician must be brought to fruition.

Behind the facade of the icy village of Farlorn, gruesome things are happening. What the enchanted Blue Lake washes up on its shores in the moonlight foreshadows a conspiracy.

Son of a Heroine ultimately leads the heroines to the Steaming Jungles south of Al'Anfa. The mission seems clear, but beneath the surface lurk unimagined dangers that must be met with death-defying courage.


Klappentext

Im Heldenwerk-Archiv V sind sieben Kurzabenteuer enthalten, die deine Spieler überall auf dem Kontinent Aventurien in Atem halten werden – denn die Arbeit eines waren Helden ist nie getan! Für diese Anthologie wurden alle Abenteuer um zusätzliches Material und ein Vorwort der jeweiligen Autoren ergänzt. Sechs der sieben Abenteuer entstammen der Heldenwerk-Reihe, das siebte wurde exklusiv für die Ulisses Online Con 2021 geschrieben.

Federfall thematisiert den Sternenfall. In klassischer Entdeckermanier gilt es, einem alten Geheimnis um vergessene Gottheiten im südlichen Almada auf die Schliche zu kommen.

Bis ins Mark schickt die Helden auf eine Verfolgungsjagd. Eine beschwerliche Reise, deren Ziel Vergeltung mit Hoffnung auf Gerechtigkeit ist, treibt sie durch die Rommilyser Mark.

Blutiger Pelz spielt im Svellttal. Tiefhusen ist gefallen. Just als die Spannung zwischen den Überlebenden vor ihrem Zerreißpunkt steht, bleiben lebenswichtige Warenlieferungen aus.

Der stille Pfad wartet mit einer unerhörten Begebenheit auf: Eine Borongeweihte in einem kleinen horasischen Küstenort bricht ihr Schweigegelübde hundertfach, und das scheinbar grundlos!

Madas Blaue Augen, ein Soloabenteuer, führt in einen uralten Tempel elementarer Macht. Durch Sultan Hasrabals Augen gilt es, Jahre der Forschung des vollendeten Magiers zu ihrer Blüte zu führen.

Hinter der Fassade des vereisten Örtchens Farlorn spielen sich grausige Dinge ab. Was der verwunschene Blaue See im Mondlicht an seine Ufer spült, lässt eine Verschwörung erahnen.

Sohn einer Heldin letztlich führt die Heldinnen in die Dampfenden Dschungel südlich von Al’Anfa. Der Auftrag erscheint klar, aber unter der Oberfläche lauern ungeahnte Gefahren, denen es todesmutig zu begegnen gilt.

boardgame.name: Inrah Kartenset
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb

This Inrah playing card set contains a full deck of 121 cards, plus 21 alternate cards, 2 overview cards, and instructions on how to use them in the game.
Aventurian Mastery is required for in-depth study as well as for use in the context of alternate rules mechanisms.


Klappentext

Dieses Inrah-Spielkartenset enthält ein vollständiges Deck von 121 Karten, zusätzlich 21 alternative Karten, 2 Übersichtskarten sowie eine Anleitung, wie man sie im Spiel einsetzen kann.
Zur Vertiefung sowie zur Nutzung im Rahmen alternativer Regelmechanismen wird Aventurische Meisterschaft vorausgesetzt.

boardgame.name: Werkzeuge des Meisters
boardgame.description:
Publisher's bluerb

Battles can quickly become a confusing affair. With the Master's Tools Box, every game round can draw on tools to better visualize conflicts: Using blips, floor plans, and templates, movements of heroes and their opponents can be effortlessly illustrated, and players and masters can keep track of their heroes' and opponents' positions at all times.

The Master's Tools Box includes:

The rules booklet Auf ins Gefecht describes in detail the use of blips and ground plans for The Black Eye. With clear examples and many card illustrations, it explains the rules of movement and combat, how to adapt known special skills and existing DSA5 rules for play with ground plans, and what other options are available through the use of blips.
This box contains blips for all characters, creatures and animals presented in the DSA5 rulebook and the Aventurian Almanac. The blips feature culture and profession illustrations of heroes, archetypes, typical master characters from the Almanac, orcs, goblins, trolls, ogres, wolves, a krakenmolch, and many more creatures. In total, the set contains 175 blips.
To play with blips, the master's tools also provide a set of useful ground plans. Included are areas with forests, caves, roads, meadows, as well as an inn including its surroundings, a marketplace, a castle and a cult place. The plans are supplied in A1 or A2 sizes, depending on the type of environment.
The template set consists of two solid die-cut sheets containing various templates so that each game round can easily determine distances when using ground plans and blips. In doing so, the two rangefinders display a distance of up to 8 paces, allowing them to be used individually or combined to display the most important distance units of DSA5 battles. Also included are templates to determine the most important radii (up to 3 steps and up to 5 steps) of spells, such as fireballs and protection spells, liturgies or other area effects. The set is supplemented by quest markers, which can be used to mark certain areas of the floor plans and can stand for items and targets of a scene, for example.



Klappentext

Kämpfe können schnell zu einer unübersichtlichen Angelegenheit werden. Mit der Werkzeuge des Meisters-Box kann jede Spielrunde auf Hilfsmittel zur besseren Darstellung von Konflikten zurückgreifen: Mithilfe von Blips, Bodenplänen und Schablonen können Bewegungen der Helden und ihrer Gegner mühelos veranschaulicht werden und Spieler und Meister behalten jederzeit die Übersicht über die Positionen ihrer Helden und der Gegner.

Die Werkzeuge des Meisters-Box umfasst:

Das Regelheft Auf ins Gefecht beschreibt im Detail den Einsatz von Blips und Bodenplänen für Das Schwarze Auge. In anschaulichen Beispielen und mit vielen Karten-Illustrationen werden die Bewegungs- und Kampfregeln erklärt, wie man bekannte Sonderfertigkeiten und bestehende DSA5-Regeln für das Spiel mit Bodenplänen anpassen kann, und welche weiteren Optionen sich durch den Einsatz von Blips ergeben.
Diese Box enthält Blips für alle Figuren, Kreaturen und Tiere, die im DSA5-Regelwerk und dem Aventurischen Almanach vorgestellt werden. Die Blips zeigen Kultur- und Professionsabbildungen von Helden, Archetypen, typische Meisterpersonen aus dem Almanach, Orks, Goblins, Trolle, Oger, Wölfe, einen Krakenmolch und viele weitere Kreaturen. Insgesamt enthält das Set 175 Blips.
Zum Spiel mit Blips liefern die Werkzeuge des Meisters auch einen Satz nützlicher Bodenpläne. Enthalten sind Gebiete mit Wäldern, Höhlen, Straßen, Wiesen sowie eine Herberge samt Umgebung, ein Marktplatz, eine Burg und ein Kultplatze. Die Pläne werden, je nach Umgebungsart, in den Größen A1 oder A2 mitgeliefert.
Das Schablonen-Set besteht aus zwei festen Stanzbögen, die verschiedene Schablonen beinhalten, damit jede Spielrunde beim Einsatz von Bodenplänen und Blips Entfernungen leicht bestimmen kann. Die beiden Entfernungsmesser zeigen dabei eine Distanz von bis zu 8 Schritt an und können damit einzeln oder kombiniert die wichtigsten Entfernungseinheiten von DSA5-Kämpfen anzeigen. Enthalten sind zudem Schablonen, um die wichtigsten Radien (bis zu 3 Schritt und bis zu 5 Schritt) von Zaubern, etwa Feuerbällen und Schutzzaubern, Liturgien oder anderen Flächenwirkungen zu bestimmen. Ergänzt wird das Set um Questmarker, die zur Markierung bestimmter Bereiche der Bodenpläne genutzt werden können und z. B. für Gegenstände und Ziele einer Szene stehen können.

boardgame.name: Werkzeuge des Meisters II
boardgame.description:
Publisher's bluerb

Battles can quickly become a confusing affair. With the tools of the Master Box 2, every game group can access aids for better representation of conflicts: With the help of blips, floor plans and templates, the movements of the heroes and their opponents can be effortlessly illustrated and players as well as masters keep track of the positions of the player figures and those of the opponents at all times.

The Master's Tools Box 2 includes:

This box contains blips for all creatures and animals presented in the Aventurian Bestiary. The blips feature ghouls, kraconians, skeletons, war dogs, and a basilisk in the flesh, among others. In total, the set contains 220 blips.
To play with Blips, the Tools of the Master Box 2 also provides a set of useful ground maps. Included are areas with mountains, sandy desert, beach, ice & snow, savannah and a road. The plans are supplied in the size DIN A2.
The included die-cut sheet contains quest markers that serve as markers on the floor plans.
Also included is a reference list that lists the full-size blips and introduces them by name.



Klappentext

Kämpfe können schnell zu einer unübersichtlichen Angelegenheit werden. Mit der Werkzeuge des Meisters-Box 2 kann jede Spielgruppe auf Hilfsmittel zur besseren Darstellung von Konflikten zurückgreifen: Mithilfe von Blips, Bodenplänen und Schablonen können die Bewegungen der Helden und ihrer Gegner mühelos veranschaulicht werden und Spieler sowie Meister behalten jederzeit die Übersicht über die Positionen der Spielerfiguren und die der Kontrahenten.

Die Werkzeuge des Meisters-Box 2 umfasst:

Diese Box enthält Blips für alle Kreaturen und Tiere, die im Aventurischen Bestiarium vorgestellt werden. Die Blips zeigen u. a. Ghule, Krakonier, Skelette, Kriegshunde und einen leibhaftigen Basilisken. Insgesamt enthält das Set 220 Blips.
Zum Spiel mit Blips liefert die Werkzeuge des Meisters-Box 2 auch einen Satz nützlicher Bodenpläne. Enthalten sind Gebiete mit Gebirge, Sandwüste, Strand, Eis & Schnee, Savanne und einer Straße. Die Pläne werden in der Größe DIN A2 mitgeliefert.
Der beigefügte Stanzbogen enthält Questmarker, die als Markierungen auf den Bodenplänen dienen.
Außerdem ist eine Referenzliste enthalten, die die Blips in Originalgröße auflistet und namentlich vorstellt.

boardgame.name: Werkzeuge des Meisters III
boardgame.description:
Publisher's bluerb
Battles can quickly become a confusing affair. With the tools of the Master Box 3, every game group can access aids for a better representation of conflicts: With the help of blips, floor plans and templates, the movements of the heroes and their opponents can be effortlessly illustrated and players as well as masters keep track of the positions of the player figures and those of the opponents at all times.

The Master's Tools Box 3 includes:

This box contains blips for all creatures and animals introduced in Aventurian Bestiary II. The blips feature ape-men, harpies, giant amoebae, khorams beasts, and a giant sea serpent, among others. In total, the set contains 220 blips.
To play with Blips, the Tools of the Master Box 2 also ranet a set of useful ground plans. Included are areas with swamp, jungle, taiga, boulder desert, riverbank and a ruined castle. The plans are supplied in the size DIN A2.
The included die-cut sheet contains quest markers that serve as markers on the floor plans.
Also included is a reference list that lists the full-size blips and introduces them by name.



Klappentext

Kämpfe können schnell zu einer unübersichtlichen Angelegenheit werden. Mit der Werkzeuge des Meisters-Box 3 kann jede Spielgruppe auf Hilfsmittel zur besseren Darstellung von Konflikten zurückgreifen: Mithilfe von Blips, Bodenplänen und Schablonen können die Bewegungen der Helden und ihrer Gegner mühelos veranschaulicht werden und Spieler sowie Meister behalten jederzeit die Übersicht über die Positionen der Spielerfiguren und die der Kontrahenten.

Die Werkzeuge des Meisters-Box 3 umfasst:

Diese Box enthält Blips für alle Kreaturen und Tiere, die im Aventurischen Bestiarium II vorgestellt werden. Die Blips zeigen u. a. Affenmenschen, Harpyien, Riesenamöben, Khoramsbestien und eine riesige Seeschlange. Insgesamt enthält das Set 220 Blips.
Zum Spiel mit Blips liefet die Werkzeuge des Meisters-Box 2 auch einen Satz nützlicher Bodenpläne. Enthalten sind Gebiete mit Sumpf, Dschungel, Taiga, Geröllwüste, Flussufer und einer Burgruine. Die Pläne werden in der Größe DIN A2 mitgeliefert.
Der beigefügte Stanzbogen enthält Questmarker, die als Markierungen auf den Bodenplänen dienen.
Außerdem ist eine Referenzliste enthalten, die die Blips in Originalgröße auflistet und namentlich vorstellt.

boardgame.name: Nandus-Vademecum
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb

Teachers, researchers, philosophers, but also strategists and revolutionaries - the image of Nandus devotees is extremely diverse. What drives them? What virtues does the responsible use of acquired knowledge require? How do they carry the light of knowledge to the darkest corners of the world? Even when this involves considerable risks to their own lives, since rulers are often hostile or even hostile to their Enlightenment goals?

This vademecum provides insight into the many aspects of the Nandus Church, offering rich ideas for shaping consecrated and other Nandus disciples. It includes information on the structure of the church, its backgrounds and saints, and the tools of consecration. The volume also sheds light from Nandusian perspectives on such questions as the methods of gaining knowledge, the rules of its transmission, and the moral principles of dealing with acquired knowledge. Philosophical ideas on the nature of the divine and the limits of all knowledge are also addressed. Last but not least, in the spirit of Nandus, the work contains mysteries that invite to puzzling and deeper study of the texts.


Klappentext

Lehrer, Forscher, Philosophen, aber auch Strategen und Revolutionäre – das Bild der Nandusgeweihten ist äußerst vielfältig. Was treibt sie an? Welche Tugenden erfordert der verantwortungsvolle Umgang mit erworbenem Wissen? Wie tragen sie das Licht der Erkenntnis weiter bis in die dunkelsten Winkel der Welt? Selbst dann, wenn dies mit erheblichen Risiken für das eigene Leben verbunden ist, da Herrscher ihren aufklärerischen Zielen oft ablehnend oder gar feindlich gegenüberstehen?

Dieses Vademecum gibt Einblicke in die vielfältigen Aspekte der Nanduskirche und bietet so reichhaltige Ideen zur Ausgestaltung von Geweihten und anderen Nandusjüngern. Es enthält Informationen zur Struktur der Kirche, zu ihren Hintergründen und Heiligen und zu den Werkzeugen der Geweihtenschaft. Der Band beleuchtet darüber hinaus aus nandusgefälligen Perspektiven solche Fragen, welche die Methoden des Wissensgewinns, die Regeln seiner Vermittlung und die moralischen Prinzipien im Umgang mit erworbenem Wissen betreffen. Philosophische Ideen zum Wesen des Göttlichen und den Grenzen aller Erkenntnis kommen dabei ebenfalls zur Sprache. Ganz im Sinne Nandus’ enthält das Werk nicht zuletzt auch Geheimnisse, die zum Rätseln und tieferem Studium der Texte einladen.

boardgame.name: Kamaluq-Vademecum
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb

How were the steaming jungles formed? What is the difference between Nipakau, Tapam and Satuul? What are the Great Taboos and how is it that the High Shamans are entrusted with their observance? What is the relationship between the jaguar-shaped creator spirit Kamaluq and the solar father Obaran?

The animistic beliefs of the Meridian woodsmen and Utulus are quite different from the belief in the Twelve as it is widespread in many parts of Aventuria. The Kamaluq Vademecum is a collection of the oral traditions of these tribes, offering answers to all these questions in atmospheric stories.

The volume is supplemented by commentaries on the legends from the pens of Aventurian scholars, as well as a chapter offering suggestions for shamans as player characters.

The Kamaluq Vademecum is an atmospheric addition to the game in Aventuria, especially of course in the Deep South. It is suitable for masters and players alike and requires no rules knowledge.


Klappentext

Wie sind die Dampfenden Dschungel entstanden? Was ist der Unterschied zwischen Nipakau, Tapam und Satuul? Was sind die Großen Tabus und wie kommt es, dass die Hochschamanen mit ihrer Einhaltung betraut sind? Was ist die Beziehung zwischen dem jaguargestaltigen Schöpfergeist Kamaluq und dem Sonnenvater Obaran?

Die animistisch geprägte Glaubenswelt der meridianischen Waldmenschen und Utulus unterscheidet sich deutlich vom Glauben an die Zwölfe, wie er in weiten Teilen Aventuriens verbreitet ist. Das Kamaluq-Vademecum ist eine Sammlung der mündlichen Überlieferungen dieser Stämme, die in stimmungsvollen Geschichten Antworten auf all diese Fragen bieten.

Ergänzt wird der Band durch Kommentare zu den Legenden aus der Feder aventurischer Gelehrter sowie ein Kapitel, das Anregungen für Schamanen als Spielercharaktere bietet.

Das Kamaluq-Vademecum ist eine stimmungsvolle Ergänzung für das Spiel in Aventurien, besonders natürlich im Tiefen Süden. Es ist für Meisterinnen und Spieler gleichermaßen geeignet und erfordert keinerlei Regelkenntnisse.

boardgame.name: Ifirn-Vademecum
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb

What is winter? Many call it exhausting and cruel, the frost is a murderer of life. I am writing about this to you, a young consecrated or acolyte, because you are spreading a light in Ifirn's name. I am putting on paper in this booklet some of my experiences and advice, so that they may help you. They should be a voice of confidence for you when there is only silence all around.

What distinguishes the belief in the semi-divine Ifirn from that in her fierce father, the winter god Firun? What are the most important tasks of the servants of the swan-like ones and where might one meet them most likely? What ideals does a consecrated one who follows the Swan Daughter Nidari follow, and where would a follower of Lidari take a different path?

The Ifirn Vademecum provides Aventurian background material on the consecration of the Swanfolk and their principles. In addition to evocative prayers and invocations, there is background information on the divine beings associated with Ifirn, as well as her human following. The volume reprocesses old knowledge and gives the belief in Ifirn an unprecedented depth of detail in countless source texts and quotations. Finally, it provides suggestions for players and game masters to flesh out their heroines and master characters who wish to set out on adventures with Ifirn in their hearts.

The Ifirn Vademecum is an atmospheric addition to the game in Aventuria. It is suitable for masters and players alike, and requires no rules knowledge.


Klappentext

Was ist der Winter? Viele nennen ihn zehrend und grausam, der Frost sei ein Mörder des Lebens. Darüber schreibe ich dir, einem jungen Geweihten oder einer Akoluthin, denn du verbreitest ein Licht in Ifirns Namen. Ich bringe in diesem Büchlein einige meiner Erfahrungen und Ratschläge zu Papier, auf dass sie dir helfen mögen. Sie sollen für dich eine Stimme der Zuversicht sein, wenn ringsherum nur Stille herrscht.

Was unterscheidet den Glauben an die halbgöttliche Ifirn von jenem an ihren grimmigen Vater, den Wintergott Firun? Was sind die wichtigsten Aufgaben der Diener der Schwanengleichen und wo mag man ihnen wohl am ehesten begegnen? Welchen Idealen folgt eine Geweihte, die der Schwanentochter Nidari folgt, und wo würde eine Anhängerin Lidaris einen anderen Pfad einschlagen?

Das Ifirn-Vademecum bietet aventurisches Hintergrundmaterial über die Geweihtenschaft der Schwanengleichen und ihre Prinzipien. Neben stimmungsvollen Gebeten und Anrufungen gibt es Hintergrundinformationen zu den göttlichen Wesen, die mit Ifirn in Verbindung stehen, wie auch zu ihrer menschlichen Gefolgschaft. Der Band bereitet altes Wissen neu auf und verleiht dem Glauben an Ifirn eine nie zuvor erreichte Detailtiefe in unzähligen Quellentexten und Zitaten. Abschließend gibt er Anregungen für Spieler und Spielleiterinnen zur Ausgestaltung ihrer Heldinnen und Meisterpersonen, die mit Ifirn im Herzen auf Abenteuer ausziehen möchten.

Das Ifirn-Vademecum ist eine stimmungsvolle Ergänzung für das Spiel in Aventurien. Es ist für Meister wie Spieler gleichermaßen geeignet, und erfordert keinerlei Regelkenntnisse.

boardgame.name: Swafnir-Vademecum
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb

What challenges must a servant of the God Whale face aboard an Otta? What are the duties of a wandering Swafnirdiar inland? What requirements must a Swafnir believer meet to be accepted as a novice? How is the cult structured and what influence does the Council of High Priests, founded after the Rapture of the High Priestess Bridgera Karvsolmfara, have? Which virtue has the highest value in the Swafnir cult and how can the sometimes contradictory ideals of faith be reconciled?

The Swafnir Vademecum contains Aventurian background material on the principles of the divine whale and its consecration. Liturgies and invocations and miracles pleasing to the deity are described as well as the children of Swafnir, whose cult knows no saints. In addition to numerous Aventurian citations, the book contains extensive suggestions for players and masters, which should make it easier to portray a Swafnir consecrated in the game and to integrate him into the game.

The Swafnir Vademecum is an atmospheric addition to the game in Aventuria, especially of course in Thorwal. It is suitable for masters and players alike and does not require any rules knowledge.


Klappentext

Welche Herausforderungen muss sich ein Diener des Gottwals an Bord einer Otta stellen? Welche Aufgaben kommen einer wandernden Swafnirdiar im Binnenland zu? Welche Anforderungen muss ein Swafnirgläubiger erfüllen, um als Novize aufgenommen zu werden? Wie ist der Kult aufgebaut und welchen Einfluss hat der nach der Entrückung der Hohepriesterin Bridgera Karvsolmfara gegründete Rat der Hohepriester? Welche Tugend hat den höchsten Stellenwert im Swafnirkult und wie lassen sich die mitunter einander widersprechenden Glaubensideale miteinander vereinbaren?

Das Swafnir-Vademecum enthält aventurisches Hintergrundmaterial über die Prinzipien des göttlichen Wals und seine Geweihtenschaft. Liturgien und der Gottheit gefällige Anrufungen und Mirakel werden ebenso beschrieben wie die Kinder Swafnirs, dessen Kult keine Heiligen kennt. Neben zahlreichen aventurischen Zitaten enthält das Buch umfangreiche Anregungen für Spielerinnen und Meister, welche die Darstellung eines Swafnirgeweihten im Spiel und dessen Einbindung erleichtern sollen.

Das Swafnir-Vademecum ist eine stimmungsvolle Ergänzung für das Spiel in Aventurien, besonders natürlich in Thorwal. Es ist für Meisterinnen und Spieler gleichermaßen geeignet und erfordert keinerlei Regelkenntnisse.

boardgame.name: Warhammer Underworlds: Harrowdeep – Blackpowder's Buccaneers
boardgame.description:
The Ogor Maneater Gorlok Blackpowder and his motley crew found themselves washed up in Harrowdeep after being sucked down from the Penumbral Sea by a whirlpool. They soon realised the ancient labyrinth offered a chance to seize a great wealth of treasure. While the Maneater sought out worthy adversaries to add to his boasting-tally, his crew proceeded to loot everything they could get their hands, claws, or beak on.

Blackpowder’s Buccaneers are as aggressive as you'd expect of a warband led by an ogor. As Blackpowder delivers devastating blows against his enemies, his followers work together to hamper the foe whilst securing the treasure they desire. This set also features universal cards usable by any warband in Warhammer Underworlds.

The first expansion for Warhammer Underworlds: Harrowdeep, featuring five characterful miniatures. Contains 70 cards for your deck, including 20 universal cards. Also contains 12 Grand Alliance cards that can be used by multiple warbands.

- 5x fighters: Gorlok Blackpowder, Kagey, Peggz, Shreek, and Mange

NOTE: The card back graphics in this set do not match those of all the previous games released in the Warhammer: Underworld series. You will not be able to mix and match cards from other previous sets with this one to deck build a unique team.

boardgame.name: Warhammer Underworlds: Harrowdeep – Illusory Might Rivals Deck
boardgame.description:
An expansion for Warhammer Underworlds, compatible with the Rivals format, which uses pre-built card decks so that you can get stuck into the game within minutes. Features 32 new universal cards which can be played with your Warband of choice or used to enhance your existing decks.

Contents:
12 Universal Objective Cards
10 Universal Gambit Cards
10 Universal Upgrade Cards

This is not a stand-alone game. A copy of any Warhammer Underworlds Core Set is required to play.

NOTE: The card back graphics in this set do not match those of all the previous games released in the Warhammer: Underworld series. You will not be able to mix and match cards from other previous sets with this one to deck build a unique team unless you sleeve the cards with opaque card sleeves.

boardgame.name: The Search for the Seastone - Part 3
boardgame.description:
From Patreon:

The final concluding part of the story campaign The Search for the Seastone! In this part it is time to face the boss of this campaign, and overcome the first multi-stage battle of your Colostle adventure.

Good luck Roomlanders, you're really going to need it. This will be your toughest battle yet.

boardgame.name: Moravod - Tor zur Anderswelt
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb

Once Moravod was covered by an enchanted forest, where the boundaries between the human world and the other world became blurred. Today, two small parts of it remain: the Carmodine, the source of nature spirits and their magic, and the Racudine, corrupted by dark forces. The magic of the forests shapes the soul of the Moravians, who live in harmony with nature and the inhabitants of the Otherworld through the mediation of their shamans and nature sorcerers. Even away from Racudin, Moravod harbors dark terrors, as the land is considered the home of werewolves and the domain of blood vampires, who are kept in check only thanks to skilled witch hunters.
Despite its remoteness, Moravod attracts people from all over the world. Goods from the Far East are shipped from the trading metropolis of Geltin, the fairy-tale town of Slamohrad attracts strangers with its craftsmanship, and legendary artifacts are created with the help of nature spirits in the forges of the master blacksmiths. In the north, the rebellious Principality of the White Mountains resists the Grand Prince's claim to power, and its mysterious Blood Princess has allied with dark forces to secure her independence.

In addition to descriptions of the land and its people, the Moravod Sourcebook includes two new adventurer types, rules for travel to the Otherworld, a detailed bestiary focusing on nature spirits, a detailed description of Geltin, and a large-format color map of the land.


Klappentext

Einst war Moravod von einem Zauberwald bedeckt, in dem die Grenzen zwischen Menschen- und Anderswelt verschwammen. Heute sind davon noch zwei kleine Teile übrig: der Karmodin als Quell der Naturgeister und ihres Zaubers und der von dunklen Mächten verdorbene Racudin. Die Magie der Wälder prägt die Seele der Moraven, die durch Vermittlung ihrer Schamanen und Naturhexer im Einklang mit der Natur und den Bewohnern der Anderswelt leben. Auch abseits des Racudin birgt Moravod düstere Schrecken, gilt das Land doch als Heimat der Werwölfe und Domäne der Blutvampire, die nur dank erfahrener Hexenjäger in Schach gehalten werden.
Seiner Abgeschiedenheit zum Trotz zieht Moravod Menschen aus aller Herren Länder an. In der Handelsmetropole Geltin werden Waren aus dem Fernen Osten verschifft, das märchenhafte Städtchen Slamohrad lockt mit seiner Handwerkskunst Fremde an, und in den Waldschmieden der Schmiedemeister entstehen mit Hilfe von Naturgeistern legendäre Artefakte. Im Norden widersetzt sich das rebellische Fürstentum der Weißen Berge dem Machtanspruch des Großfürsten, und seine geheimnisumwitterte Blutfürstin hat sich mit dunklen Mächten verbündet, um ihre Unabhängigkeit zu sichern.

Neben der Beschreibung von Land und Leuten enthält das Quellenbuch zu Moravod zwei neue Abenteurertypen, Regeln für Reisen in die Anderswelt, ein ausführliches Bestiarium mit Schwerpunkt auf Naturgeistern, eine ausführliche Beschreibung Geltins sowie eine froßformatige Farbkarte des Landes.
boardgame.rpgpublisher: Verlag für Fantasy- und Science Fiction-Spiele

boardgame.name: Panzer Dice 2: Last Battle
boardgame.description:
Second part of the succesful solitaire Roll and Write game, Panzer Dice: Eastern Front, Panzer Dice 2: Last battle! takes you to the battle of Berlin. You no longer have to fight in the Russian steppe but in the streets of a burning city.

Berlin, summer of 1945. The Red Army are at the gates of the city. It’s the last battle. Streets are yet full of Wehrmacht soldiers and SS fanatics defending each building, resisting in each corner with their last artillery units.

You are a Squad of a T-34 Tank and nine Infantry soldiers with on a special mission delivered by Gueorgui Zhùkov in person. If your Squad reaches the goal with at least one alive Infantry soldier you have completed the mission.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Coldying
boardgame.description:
From itch.io:

Fire is no more. And cannot be kindled again.

The Package is fragile and will not make it for long.

All you see is snow, ice and darkness.

But there is a dimmed light in a distance, down in the valley. Will you make it? Will you keep The Package safe and alive?

Do what you must. Protect it with your idle life.
boardgame.rpgseries: The Cold and Deathless Northern Darkness Jam Submissions

boardgame.name: The Ice Pirates Of Penn-Tayn
boardgame.description:
From itch.io:

From the darkness they strike, riding in their pirate ice cutters! You and your group of desperate companions are hired to defend the villagers and merchants on the vast, frozen lakes. But will you survive ship-to-ship combat and pirate duels, or the hidden menace beneath the ice? More importantly, will you receive all the pickled fish you can carry?

This one page adventure is Mörk Borg-compatible and was created for the "Northern Darkness" jam.
boardgame.rpgseries: The Cold and Deathless Northern Darkness Jam Submissions

boardgame.name: For Whom The Were-Moose Cometh
boardgame.description:
From itch.io:

Something were-moose this way comes... This one page Mörk Borg-compatible adventure made for the "Northern Darkness" jam has everything you need, including cold, hunger, paranoia and lycan-moosery. It will provide about an hour's enjoyment if you survive the cold, your quarry and your treacherous companions.

boardgame.name: Quillermo
boardgame.description:
From itch.io:

Quillermo is a grouchy master duelist NPC designed for the Mausritter table-top role-playing game.

boardgame.name: El Gekco
boardgame.description:
From itch.io:

El Gekco is a daring and conceited NPC designed for the Mausritter table-top role-playing game.

boardgame.name: The Seer at Helen's Pond
boardgame.description:
From itch.io:

The Seer at Helen's Pond is a wise and far-seeing NPC for the Mausritter table-top role-playing game.

boardgame.name: One-Eyed Sligo
boardgame.description:
From itch.io:

One-Eyed Sligo is an extremely driven NPC ready to be plopped into your Mausritter game. What's he driven to do? Rid the world of magic.

boardgame.name: Lupin Rainbow
boardgame.description:
From itch.io:

Lupin Rainbow is an NPC for the Mausritter ttrpg designed to further explore the realm of ghosts within the game.

boardgame.name: Voidtouched
boardgame.description:
From itch.io:

Long ago, we left behind our natural home. Now, we traverse the heavens, traversing an endless and enigmatic void never meant for us. All we knew for all our existance - the sun, the horizon, even our natural gravity - is long behind us. It is time we become more like the void that is our home or be lost like a stranger in the dark.

To be Voidtouched is to understand that the grand mysteries of space require more than mundane, rational thinking. If the unexplained is commonplace, then perhaps you need new explanations.

The Voidtouched is a 1e-compatible player class for the Mothership Sci-Fi Horror RPG.

boardgame.name: The Crumbling Colonnade
boardgame.description:
From itch.io:

A gang boss is haunted by the ghosts of his many victims. His only respite is an abandoned temple warded against those spirits. There's a price on his head and clues to hidden treasure underneath the temple.

The Crumbling Colonnade is a system-neutral TTRPG scenario in three pages, suitable as a drop-in location in a sandbox or a short bounty job for an enterprising party.

boardgame.name: Phantasmagoria of Drifting Blossoms
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Summary: Venture into the Domain of Delight Mayoiga, a land where humans and monsters known as youkai coexist. Today is the day of the cherry blossom festival. All is going well until a piece of the shrine ritual to welcome spring has been stolen!

A Four-Hour Adventure for Tier 1 Characters. Optimized for APL 3.
boardgame.rpgseries: DC-WBW Dungeoncraft, The Wild Beyond the Witchlight

boardgame.name: An Underdodge Story
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The thin veil between our world and the land of Underdodge is open, and the archfey is challenging those he deems worthy to a competition of ultimate athletic prowess. Do you have what it takes to secure total victory?

A Four-Hour Adventure for Tier 2 Characters. Optimized for APL 9.

CONTENT WARNING: Gambling, Predatory Behavior
boardgame.rpgseries: DC-WBW Dungeoncraft, The Wild Beyond the Witchlight

boardgame.name: Tabletop Gaming (Issue 63 - Feb 2022)
boardgame.description:
Tabletop Gaming
February 2022

Warhammer Fantasy Roleplay

boardgame.description:
Part of Dice Tower Kickstarter 2021 as a replacement promo for the unfulfilled Harry Potter Hogwarts Battle promo.

Hard Challenge:
Follow the Silver Doe
costs 9 Potions - 9 Defense against Dark Arts - 3 Knowledge

boardgame.name: The Great War
boardgame.description:
MacGowan & Lombardy's "The Great War" by award-winning game designer Dana Lombardy is a simple, fast-playing stand-alone (non-collectible) 2-player & SOLO Card-Wargame built around important weapon systems, commanders, and other historical aspects of this unprecedented industrial-scale war. One player represents Germany. The other player represents the Entente Allies of Great Britain and France.

Two 54-card decks feature colorized historical images and illustrations by game industry Hall of Fame graphic artist Rodger B. MacGowan. Icons, insignias, and game text on each card eliminate the need for complex rules. Nearly all of Rodger's exceptional WW1 illustrations appear on the cards.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.description:
From the PDF:

A mysterious heir. A fortune in gems and jewelry. An unguarded crypt. What could go wrong?

An adventure for 4-6 characters of levels 3-4.

boardgame.name: Great War at Sea: Carribbean Empires, Part I
boardgame.description:
In 1823, U.S. Secretary of State John Quincy Adams wrote to the American Minister to Spain, noting that Spanish-ruled Cuba would likely be annexed by the United States within the next 50 years. Despite several attempts, that did not happen, though in 1898 the U.S. defeated Spain and made Cuba a puppet state.

In Caribbean Empires, Part One, the Maine crisis of 1898 brings the United States and Spain to the brink of war, but the newspaper circulation wars do not spill over into an actual armed conflict. That comes a decade later, after both have built up their forces in anticipation of a naval war in the Caribbean basin. And in 1908, the United States finds a pretext to start an invasion of Spain’s Caribbean Empire.

Caribbean Empires, Part One is an expansion set for Great War at Sea: Remember the Maine. It adds 80 new pieces (60 “long” ship pieces and 20 standard-sized ones), and uses pieces and the map from Remember the Maine. The Americans have the pre-dreadnought battleships of the Great White Fleet, plus some other designs that were considered but never built. The Spanish have also built a fleet of pre-dreadnoughts, pouring resources into an effort to keep their empire alive and maintain the long-departed illusion of Great Power status.

—description from the publisher

Players have two snakes which move every turn, but only one can be controlled at a time while the other continues in the same direction as last turn.

The goal is to juggle controlling both snakes without running into barriers which are randomly scattered on the paper or placed by your opponent.

Each game board printed from the website is unique.

boardgame.name: Pot-YUCK!
boardgame.description:
Pot-YUCK! is a party game in which 3-5 players combine Food, Spice, and Method cards from their hand to create the worst combination possible and get promoted for their accomplishment.

Players take turns being the Manager, who starts the round by drawing a recipe card which defines the food the other players must make (ex. ____ Cheesecake, which must use at least 1 Food or 1 Spice card). All players present their version of that recipe, and the Manager then chooses which they think is the worst combination, promoting the winner to the next kitchen-based rank. Each rank brings with it perks and limitations (e.g. a player with the Prep Cook rank may not use meat or fish in their recipes). If a player catches another player using items their current rank doesn't allow, the offending player loses rank!

Gameplay also includes Method cards, for adding to the "grossness" of a combination, and Kitchen Items, which can be played to ban certain foods in a round, challenge other players, change a player's rank, or even enforce new rules for the round.

Play continues, rotating the Manager role each round, with players leveling up through 5 ranks (Dishwasher, Prep Cook, Line Cook, Sous Chef, Head Chef), until a player wins a round while Head Chef and wins the game!

boardgame.name: Damask
boardgame.description:
From the great trading center of Damascus, via the Silk Road, ancient weaving techniques and motifs made their way to the famous textile houses of Venice. Master weavers used draw looms to create richly woven fabrics that became known as damasks. For centuries, these luxurious silks lavished the wardrobes and halls of mansions and palaces across Europe.

In Damask, players play the roles of these master weavers, trying to make the most money, while also gaining the favor of the Weavers' Guild. In more detail, the game includes 72 damask cards, with the damasks being two of six colors and one of four patterns; place 26 cubes (which come in six colors) at random on the spinning wheel, lay out a pattern and color card at random for each "season" that the game will be played (two in a short game, three in a normal one), then lay out six damask cards at random. Each player drafts a damask card, then you refill the display.

On a turn, either you take a damask card and place it in front of you, or you draft cubes from the spinning wheel by choosing a cube, then going clockwise or counter-clockwise until you hit the second cube of any color. Collect all of those cubes, placing them on damask cards as you wish and keeping the remainder in your overstock. Each damask card requires three cubes of one color and two of another to complete. After the required action, you can take one of two optional actions: Take all cubes of one color from an opponent's overstock (with them receiving a guild favor in compensation), or mount a damask by returning the five cubes on it and standing it in your personal holder. You earn 1 coin when mounting a damask and 1 additional coin for each color or pattern it has that matches the previous damask you mounted, i.e., at most 4 coins.

If a mounted damask also matches the season's color or pattern, you gain guild favors. Each guild favor has a color or pattern on it, and you can use them to mount damasks in place of missing cubes, replace damask cards available in the display, mount an additional damask, or avoid paying taxes for extraneous cubes left in your supply at the end of a season. Three guild favors are worth 1 coin at game's end, and in addition to coins earned during the game, you receive bonus coins at game's end for having all six colors or all four patterns among your mounted damasks. Whoever earns the most coins wins.

boardgame.name: 笑ってはいけない音読 (Warattewa Ikenai Ondoku)
boardgame.description:
笑ってはいけない音読 (Warattewa Ikenai Ondoku) is a word game from Japan. Players are students in a classroom, and take turns reading aloud from a story. The story is from a popular folklore in Japan, about Momotaro, the Peach Boy.

Players take turns to read a paragraph of the story, but in a style given on a card drawn from the deck. If anyone laughs while reading or listening, that player receives a piece of chalk as a penalty. At the end of play, the student who has the fewest sticks of chalk is the winner.

boardgame.name: Soldier Kings: Pragmatic Sanction – Europe at War, 1740-1748
boardgame.description:
In October 1740, Holy Roman Emperor Charles VI ate a poisonous mushroom and died, leaving no sons. Over the weeks that followed, one European power after another reneged on their promises to support his daughter Maria Theresa’s inheritance of the “crown lands” of Austria, Bohemia and Hungary. In December the newly-crowned King Frederick II invaded Austrian territory without the courtesy of a declaration of war.

Maria Theresa’s ministers counseled compromise. Her husband urged Maria Theresa to placate Frederick with gifts of territory. The 23-year old Archduchess refused. “I found myself,” she wrote later, “without money, without credit, without an army, without experience and knowledge of my own and finally, also without any counsel because each one of them wanted to wait and see how things would develop.”

The War of the Austrian Succession would last for eight years and eventually involve almost all of Europe. The resolve of Maria Theresa and the fierce loyalty of her soldiers assured that Austria would not perish.

Pragmatic Sanction is a complete game for two to eight players, based on the events of the War of the Austrian Succession. Players represent the crowned heads of the great powers of Europe: Austria, Prussia, Russia, Sweden, Britain, France, Spain and the Ottoman Empire. It uses the same game engine as our Soldier Kings game, and is very similar to Soldier Emperor.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Soldier Kings: Sultan and Shah
boardgame.description:
During and after the Napoleonic period, Ottoman Turkish armies fought the French, Russians, British, Persians, Wahhabis, Greeks, Serbs and Egyptians. The decaying empire retained enormous military strength, and despite repeated defeats both maintained its independence and enacted a series of military, economic and political reforms aimed at restoring the empire’s power.

Sultan and Shah is an expansion book for Soldier Emperor, focused on the Ottoman Empire as well as its satellite Egypt and rival Persia. Just as these so-called gunpowder empires formed a bridge between east and west, so does Sultan and Shah, which connects Soldier Emperor and Indian Empires into one large game stretching from Scotland to Scindia.

Sultan and Shah includes a full-sized (22x28 inches) map of Persia and Central Asia connecting the two games, plus a dozen new high-quality playing cards, 25 new huge playing pieces representing armies and fleets and 24 simply large ones that serve as leaders and markers. The book includes historical background, game analysis, additional scenarios and variants for Soldier Emperor and Indian Empires, and the rules, cards and pieces needed to link the two games together.

—description from the publisher
boardgame.boardgamefamily: Series: Avalanche Press Gold Club Golden Journal Supplements

boardgame.name: Soldier Emperor: Asian Empires Land War in Asia, 1759-1825
boardgame.description:
War ravaged the globe during the late 18th and early 19th centuries. Europe saw the French Revolution and then the Napoleonic Wars, while India underwent the struggles of powerful local dynasties against both one another and European invaders.

In South-East Asia, the kingdoms of Burma, Siam and Viet-Nam fought one another, the British and the Chinese Qing Empire. Meanwhile China’s Qinglong Emperor mounted his Ten Great Campaigns to expand Chinese rule to the west, south-west and south against the Dzunghar Empire, Burma, Nepal and Viet-Nam.

Soldier Emperor: Asian Empires is a complete game in the Soldier Emperor game system, based on these wars for Asia with over a dozen scenarios featuring two to four players (Burma, Siam, Nepal, Viet-Nam, Dzunghar, Qing – not all of them appear in every scenario). It uses the same rules set as Soldier Emperor and Soldier Emperor: Indian Empires, modified for the new theater. If you know how to play one of those, you already know how to play Asian Empires.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Rhino Hero: Missing Match
超級犀牛 雙胞協尋
boardgame.description:
In celebration of the 10th anniversary of Rhino Hero, HABA is proud to introduce Rhino Hero: Missing Match, a fast and furious reverse-matching speed game that’s fun for all ages.

The villain Forest Fox has been wrecking havoc in Rhino City. He's been making one of each of the many pairs of twins disappear. The goal of the game is for the superhero player to find the twin card which has the missing pair. During each round, a player acts as the villain Forest Fox who keeps their chosen missing twin card out of sight while the other players, who act as the superheroes, close their eyes.

The superheroes then start searching for the twin card with the missing pair after the villain player turns over the sand timer. If a superhero player thinks they've found it, they immediately mark the card with their play figure. If the correct twin card is marked, the round ends and they receive both twin cards. If the incorrect twin card is marked, they may not continue searching anymore and the round continues. If all superhero players marked the wrong twin card or the sand timer runs out, the villain player wins the round and keeps the twin cards they hid.

The game ends when only 8 twin cards remain in the center at the end of the round. The winner is the player with the most pairs of twins. If there is a tie, the tied players shall share the win.

boardgame.name: Schlacht (シュラハ)
boardgame.description:
シュラハ (Schlacht) is a two player strategy game from Japan, which pits two small armies against each other, akin to Chess.

The game board is a mix of land and sea hexes. Both players have a set of 12 pieces; spears, archers, shields, cavalry, longship, infantry, and a castle to protect. The players take turns rolling a die numbered 1-3, and move their pieces accordingly. The first to capture their opponents castle is the winner.
user summary
boardgame.boardgamepublisher: Board Game Production Committee (ボドゲ製作委員会)

boardgame.name: Crime Zoom: A Dirty Objective
boardgame.description:
Crime Zoom is a series of investigation game for 1 and more players and for plays of about 1 hour.

In Crime Zoom, you will conduct your investigation freely. Discuss between players to choose the tracks to follow. And as soon as you think you have solved the case, go to the questionnaire. Who is guilty? What is his motive? What is the murder weapon? And some subsidiary questions, of course. The solution will answer each of the questions. The epilogue will come to tell all this in a story or a testimony history to understand the plot that has been played.

Crime Zoom: A Dirty Objective is a demo case of the Crime Zoom family (in only 38 cards). It brings you in Brooklyn in 1980.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Eyelet
boardgame.description:
Eyelet is a roll-and-move game for two players in which shoelaces are threaded through holes in a custom-cut board. Any lace can be moved by either player, but it must be moved the exact number of spaces rolled, then threaded through an empty hole. When you're unable to complete your turn, you lose. And so, the goal is to maneuver the laces to limit your opponent's options — but should they escape, they might just hand your crafty trap back to you.

This is a simple, strange, and sprightly little game that takes only a minute to learn. There's something soothing about the sound of the shoelace sliding against the board as you pull it through. And there's something gently nerve-wracking as the holes get fewer and fewer and the laces start to get shorter and shorter. Each match results in a unique and visually appealing crisscross of blue and pink laces. Every lace has a knot carefully tied at one end by hand — by either designer Amabel Holland, publisher Mary Holland, or one of our friends.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: ジャムセッション (JAM SESSION)
boardgame.description:
ジャムセッション (JAM SESSION) is a card game from Japan with cats playing jazz (not to be confused with Jam Session).

Players each uses their own deck of bidding cards to gain musical instrument cards for their jazz band. Each player deck has its own set of numbers.

A selection of instrument cards are made out to be bid upon, and players choose from their hand a number of cards to bid face-down. When the bids are shown, the highest bid chooses an instrument first, then the next highest bid and so on.

The players decks have different sets of numbers, and every instrument card in the game is unique.

There are seven kinds of instruments, appearing in four colours. The more different instruments a player gathers, the more points they score. But after scoring, they must discard the most cards in one colour. So by gathering diverse colours, they can quickly reform their band and score again.

Scoring occurs at the end of each round (a jam session).

If a player gets all seven types of instrument into their hand, they instantly win the game. Otherwise the most points wins at the end.

The way the instruments are selected for bidding also depends on players' hands, so they are not simply appearing randomly.
user summary

名も無き猫達の演奏会

概要
このゲームはJAZZをテーマにしたカードゲームです。
貴重なメンバーが去って行かないように注意しながら、様々な楽器を演奏するメンバーを集めることで勝利を目指します。

ゲームの流れ
〇準備
各プレイヤーは４つのデッキから１つを選んで受け取ります。
デッキはそれぞれ内容が異なるので、デッキによって最適な戦略は異なるでしょう。

進行
基本的な流れは以下の通りです。
　・手札の補充
　・手札を１枚ずつ出す
　・場札を１枚ずつ取る
　・セッション（点数計算）
　・撤収
　・次ラウンドの準備

・手札の補充
自分の山札から１枚だけカードを引いて手札に加えます。
山札が尽きた後は補充は無くなります。

・手札を出す ⇒ 場札を取る
プレイヤーは場に出ているカードを１枚ずつ取るのですが、カードを取る順番を競りで決定します。
そのためにプレイヤーは手札から１枚ずつカードを出します。

数値の大きいカードを出したプレイヤーから順に、１枚ずつ場に出ているカードを取ります。
ただし、最も小さい数値を出したプレイヤーのみ『場のカードを取らない』という選択ができ、戦略上とても重要になります。

・セッション ⇒ 撤収
規定枚数のカードを取ったプレイヤーは、その度に点数計算を行います。
獲得したカードの『種類』が多いほど、点数が多く貰えます。
点数計算の後、最も多い『色』のカードを全て捨てます。

種類が多いと１回に得られる点数が多く、色が多いと点数計算の機会が多く訪れます。
そのため、種類と色の両方を上手く集めることが重要になります。

・次ラウンドの準備
最初にカードを取ったプレイヤーが『リードカード』を受け取ります。
リードカードを持っているプレイヤーが、次ラウンドの最初に手番を行います。

勝利条件
カードを使い切ったときに最も得点の高かったプレイヤーの勝利です。
ただし、ゲーム中に７種類のカードを全て集めたプレイヤーがいた場合、即座にそのプレイヤーの勝利となります。
publisher's summary

boardgame.name: Galactic Poker
boardgame.description:
Although the rules do not explicitly reference Battlestar Galactica, this set of 55 custom hexagonal cards bears elements showing that the game was inspired by the seventies TV show, including two cards that display Cylon helmets and an Ovion "Death Card." In keeping with the theme, there are rules regarding gameplay when the ship you are stationed on is at yellow or red alert status. Cheating is explicitly authorized in the rules, but with penalties for being caught. There are no face cards in the game. The cards of the four suits are ranked in value from 2 to 13 plus a Pyramid card. The three special cards with Cylon or Ovion markings round out the deck.

Galactic Poker comes with rules for four different games:

"Pyramid" - the name of a card game the characters played on the seventies TV series, Battlestar Galactica;

"Red Eye" - perhaps just a generic reference to Cylons, but Red-Eye is also the name of a specific Cylon character featured in a 1978 episode of the TV series;

"Draw" - in reference to a fast-draw western showdown with blaster pistols; and

"Galactic Strip" - which is exactly what the name implies - a game where you wager articles of clothing rather than money - and where the Death Card causes you to lose all of your attire, except for your blaster and holster!

Other Implementations of Pyramid

This implementation of Pyramid is different from that reflected in the game Triad (the name given to the card game in the newer version of the TV series) and appears to be an independently designed game rather than a variant of Triad. In addition, the cards shown in the BGG entry currently described (without attribution) as the "Official Version" of Pyramid appear to use the same artwork as this set, but that deck has 56 cards, with four Cylons and no Death Card.

—user summary

There are thousands of forms of Poker through out (sic) the galaxy. They differ only in details & all basically follow the same elementary principles. The following rules are not the only games of Poker that can be played with these cards. They are a galactic deck which can be used for most any card game.

May the Lords smile upon you with great fortune!

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Gribouillis Party
boardgame.description:
A drawing game for kids with a few funny constraints, like drawing a dinosaur with a pen stuck in its toes.

Every turn, a team rolls the dice and advances the corresponding number of squares. depending on the type of case, you can win a"pencils" token by successfully completing challenges. The first team with 10 "pencils" wins.

boardgame.name: EXIT: Das Spiel + Puzzle – Das Gold der Piraten
boardgame.description:
An exciting story, four puzzles and many surprising riddles: 1-4 players puzzle their way from place to place, discover the 4 unknown motifs, combine them together and solve the riddles.

Only together you can unravel the mysterious secret of the pirates' gold in this EXIT game!

In EXIT: Das Spiel + Puzzle – Das Gold der Piraten, there are riddles within riddles, hidden within four 88-piece jigsaw puzzles. Like other Exit titles, Das Gold der Piraten has no game board, but it also has no riddle cards. Instead, there are four jigsaw puzzles that you will find and assemble, one at a time. Each completed puzzle reveals a location containing more riddles to decipher.

Contents: 4 jigsaw puzzles, 14 puzzle documents, 11 strange pieces, 1 decoding disc, 1 set of instructions

boardgame.name: EXIT: Das Spiel – Das Vermächtnis des Weltreisenden
boardgame.description:
Around the world with EXIT! The world-famous professor Ian Jones recently passed away. The archaeologist loved puzzles! His travels took him to all parts of the world. He tirelessly searched for treasures believed to be lost, deciphered codes and translated secret writings.

In this EXIT game, the 1-4 players can prove what they have learned from the professor while searching for his estate. Can you decipher the professor's legacy? Luckily, there are many tools at your disposal in this escape room game. Hurry, the time is ticking!

EXIT: Das Spiel – Das Vermächtnis des Weltreisenden is a puzzle game modeled after escape rooms, and it includes components meant to be folded, written upon, or torn, so it's marketed as a single-use game.

boardgame.name: EXIT: Das Spiel – Adventskalender: Der lautlose Sturm
boardgame.description: EXIT: Das Spiel – Adventskalender: Der lautlose Sturm is an EXIT game and a 24-part adventure story in one. To unravel the mystery of the Silent Storm, you must open a little calendar door every day. Behind each, you will find a new exciting puzzle, the solution of which will help you to move onto the next room. Only if you follow the clues and solve all 24 puzzles will you find the thief and the book...and save Christmas.
boardgame.boardgamefamily: Misc: Advent / Christmas / Jule calendar game

boardgame.name: Munchkin Babies
Munchkin Babys
boardgame.description: Munchkin Babies delivers 168 cards full of sweet, adorable baby adventurers . . . who are just as good at backstabbing and loot-grabbing as their elders from Munchkin. Play a cute Orcling, Dwarfling, Elfling, or Quarterling (half a Halfling). Go to preschool to learn your Class: Wiz Kid, Ankle Biter, Crumb Snatcher, or Holy Terror, and then arm yourself with the scariest items from the toy box: the Kazoo of Constant Whining, Kid-Safe Stabbinator, Blame-Resistant Pajamas, and of course, the Extremely Pokey Spoon. You must fight fearsome monsters such as the Jealous Kitty, the Hootin' Nanny, the Napmare, and, worst of all, the Pediatrician! Grab their treasure and crawl your way to Level 10!

boardgame.name: The Dealer
boardgame.description:
Who can try to keep a poker face during a thumb war against a Cavalier? The first to have no more cards in his personal deck win the game.

All players start with their own same deck of cards. They then draw 3 cards from it which constitutes their starting hand. In turn, each player plays a card from his or her hand by placing it on the mat in the frame corresponding to one of the 5 families of the game (Spades, Clubs, Jokers, Hearts, Diamonds).

Each card causes an effect when it played. Spades and Clubs allow you to put cards from your deck on top of an opponent’s deck. Joker allow you to do special effects. Hearts and Diamonds allow you to draw cards while emptying your deck. As the rounds progress, 5 piles of cards are formed on the mat. The top visible cards of these piles form a combination. As soon as someone notices it, an additional effect is applied.

The game ends when one player has no cards left. That player wins the game.

boardgame.name: The Serpent Cult
boardgame.description:
From the publishers blurb:

The Serpent Cult is a short, system neutral adventure module. It is designed as a one-shot, meaning that a group of players should be able to get through it in one session.

The adventure contains:
A small region, The Windswept Coast,
The small town of Haven,
4 Unique NPC:s, complete with goals, fears and quirks to make them easy to run,
A dungeon, The Sunken Temple,
A random encounter table for when traveling The Windswept Coast,
Much more.

Story:
The adventure takes place on The Windswept Coast, where a newly formed cult has awakened a sleeping hydra which has wreaked havoc along the coast, creating trouble for the peaceful fishing village of Haven. The adventurers are now tasked with making the coast safe again.

Old school design, new school layout!
This adventure is built upon the principles of old school tabletop gaming, sometimes called OSR.

What that means is that it’s expected of the players to solve puzzles and traps through clever thinking, not by “throwing dice at them”.

The old school approach to adventure design also mean that the combat encounters are not balanced against anything, they are just logically composed, meaning that the number of wolves the PC:s can encounter is not based on the level of their characters, but on the logical question: “How many wolves are there in a pack?”.

It’s important that you as the Game Master are prepared for this, and give the players sufficient hints whenever they encounter something that their characters would reasonable interpret as deadly.

But don’t worry if a player character dies, risk is part of the job.

Each Free Map Friday ZIP contains five 5100x3300 pixel (600 dpi) high-resolution versions of a single dungeon map. Those versions include:

boardgame.name: Symposium
boardgame.description:
Symposium: A Game About Asking Questions

Publisher's blurb:

Symposium is a Descended From The Queen storytelling card game for 3-8 players, simulating a philosophical dinner party (or "symposium") in the classical style of the ancient Greek world and based on Plato's work of the same name, with some modifications to make it more accessible to a modern audience.

In the game you play guests at dinner party filled with interesting people: philosophers, poets, doctors, playwrights, and many others. All the best things in life are there: good food, wine, beautiful servants, and interesting conversation. You are a guest, and after you get comfortable your host makes a request of you: make a speech in praise of love. Every guest gives a speech, the contents of which are directed by a different metaphysical perspective. If your speech is the best one, the host will award you the relevant card.

After this initial round of play the role of host shifts, new perspectives are selected, and a new Question card is drawn by a new host; introducing the players to a variety of interesting questions. (What is is to be wise? What is courage? Why do I still love them?) Fresh speeches are given, and the card is awarded. Play continues in this manner until the “You are drunk” card is selected, at which point the game is over. The guest with the most cards at the end of the game not only wins, but is also the wisest.

boardgame.name: Symposium: The Hosioi
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Symposium: The Hosioi is a supplement for Symposium: A Game About Asking Questions. It includes 16 more Philosophy Cards based on religious and modern metaphysical perspectives, plus 55 more Questions which can be contemplated at your philosophical dinner party.

boardgame.name: Red Giant
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

“Life is tragic simply because the earth turns, and the sun inexorably rises and sets, and one day, for each of us, the sun will go down for the last, last time. Perhaps the whole root of our trouble, the human trouble, is that we will sacrifice all the beauty of our lives, will imprison ourselves in totems, taboos, crosses, blood sacrifices, steeples, mosques, races, armies, flags, nations, in order to deny the fact of death, which is the only fact we have. It seems to me that one ought to rejoice in the fact of death – ought to decide, indeed, to earn one’s death by confronting with passion the conundrum of life.”

― James Baldwin, The Fire Next Time


YOU CANNOT SAVE THIS WORLD.

Stories passed down through the ages all describe in detail a day long ago where the sun suddenly grew and became consumed in a blood red color. As the people stared at the sky a crimson haze slowly crept across the surface of the planet. It’s been said that this was the beginning of what was known as “the end of the world” or “the rapture” by people of that time.

From this day forward humanity and the world that they knew was forever changed, horrific beings and aberrations began to rise, seemingly from the soil itself. Beings of absolute terror and structures the human mind cannot comprehend appeared from nothingness. It was not long before humanity was ultimately driven to the edge of extinction, facing these impossible threats.

People now eke out a small existence throughout the lands attempting to avoid or defeat the horrors and creatures that have awakened from the planet in order to survive, but for what and for what cost?

boardgame.name: Toad Queen's Ruined Temple
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A ruined, overgrown temple built from thick stone on the edge of a lake, overlooking its vast expanses. The jungle behind it has begun to creep in past its walls, with wildflowers sprawling along the ground and up walls. A crack at the heart of the temple allows water to pour in, while nearby a pool waits, tranquil.

With this map and its detailed one-shot adventure, you’ll save so much time as you prepare for a fun session. The battlemap comes ready for both VTTs and easy home (or professional) printing—so you can use it no matter how you prefer to run your sessions!

boardgame.name: Blood Well Fortress
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This dark, gruesome, and spiked fortress reeks of evil, blood, and death. It has been gouged out of a cliff in a forest so dark hardly any light shines through the thick, grey mists.

With this map and its detailed one-shot adventure prompt featuring a runaway teenage girl and secret ring of vampires, you’ll save so much time as you prepare for a fun session. The battlemap comes ready for both VTTs and easy home (or professional) printing—so you can use it no matter how you prefer to run your sessions!

boardgame.name: Shadowlands Bloodwell Outpost
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This dark, gruesome, and spiked ruined fortress was once the site of a great evil. Now it is oppressed by a heavy curse, and toxic mushrooms grow throughout it.

With this map and its detailed one-shot adventure prompt featuring an artifact corrupted by an ancient war, you’ll save so much time as you prepare for a fun session. The battlemap comes ready for both VTTs and easy home (or professional) printing—so you can use it no matter how you prefer to run your sessions!

boardgame.name: Overgrown Seaside Temple Fortress
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Clear water shows the vibrant sea life darting to and fro on this sea-shelf, while an overgrown temple waits above; carved into a cliff.

With this map and its detailed one-shot adventure prompt featuring a man from the sea seeking to prove his innocence to his people, you’ll save so much time as you prepare for a fun session. The battlemap comes ready for both VTTs and easy home (or professional) printing—so you can use it no matter how you prefer to run your sessions!

boardgame.name: The Slender Man
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

It doesn’t matter if you believe in it...

It believes in you...

Appearing only in the corner of the eye ... in slightly blurred photographs ... hidden in shadows just out of view ... is the Slender Man.

Super Powered Legends. Because sometimes you a need a character everyone recognizes, even when meeting them for the first time.

boardgame.name: Handsome Sengoku ◆ Love over time: A new encounter
イケメン戦国◆時をかける恋 新たなる出逢い
boardgame.description: Anime

Rules and quick references for the Warpland RPG.

boardgame.name: Vandrouki: Европа
boardgame.description:
Each player is a traveller with the unique citizenship. For instance, in order to go to the long journey, Russian citizen need to get internation passport. Belarusian citizen has internation passport by default, but he can visit a little amount of countries without visas.

A board is a map of Europe. The goal of the travellers is to collect as many points as they can for visited countries. And this is not always about countries' quantity.

In the beginning of a game a player gets citizenship (Russia, Belarus, Ukraine or Kazakhstan), 100 euro and three bonus cards. A player puts his meeple on the board in a country of his citizenship.

In a player's turn he can do one of the following actions:
- to visit a new country by bus, by plane or
by hitchhiking. A player moves his meeple to new country on the board. In order to do it he needs to pay corresponding money (price for bus travel or plane travel) or roll a dice (using luck in hitchhiking).
- to earn money by working in a player's current country.
- to make Visa (Schengen Visa or UK Visa). Without Visa it is impossible to visit most countries in the game.
- to make international passport.
Also a player in his turn can play bonus cards.

For visiting new country a player gets a flag of the country and gets corresponding points; then he gets a bonus card.

A game ends when all countries are visited. A player with the most points wins.

boardgame.name: Marvel HeroClix: X-Men House of X
boardgame.description:
Mutants are the future, and the future begins now! The stories of HOUSE OF X and POWERS OF X intertwine to reveal the secret past, present, future, and far future of Mutantkind! It all starts when Charles Xavier reveals his new masterplan for Mutantkind, one that will bring mutants out of the shadow of humanity and into the light.

The set contains characters from the House of X series published by Marvel comics The game is played on a gridded map that is 24x36 inches. the game is played with pre-painted miniatures. the goal of the game is to either defeat your opponents entire team or accumulate more points than your opponent in a timed game. Each miniature is allocated a certain number of points printed on the base of the mini.

The game plays much like a miniatures game. Most of the vital statistical information is directly on the base of the characters, which can be rotated as characters take damage from hits.

boardgame.name: Marvel HeroClix: Fantastic Four Future Foundation
boardgame.description:
Reed Richards assembled the Future Foundation because an entire generation of geniuses would do more good than he ever could. Whether you’re fighting the Heralds of Galactus or Dr. Doom, you’ll be able to build a team of characters that support and LEARN NEW ABILITIES from one another!

The set contains characters from the Fantastic Four and the Marvel Universe. The game is played on a gridded map that is 24x36 inches. the game is played with prepainted miniatures. the goal of the game is to either defeat your opponents entire team or accumulate more points than your opponent in a timed game. Each miniature is allocated a certain number of points printed on the base of the mini.1 vs 1 miniatures collectible game.

The game plays much like a miniatures game. Most of the vital statistical information is directly on the base of the characters, which can be rotated as characters take damage from hits.

boardgame.name: Die Seehunde
boardgame.description:
A one of a kind tactical World War 2 solitaire war game. Take control of a German midget submarine "Seehund" (Seal), to attack British convoys in the North-Sea. Featuring a replica of a Torpedo calculating disc, torpedo warfare has never been simulated more realistic within a purely analog board game. Experience the peril of a submarine crew, operating a new, barely field tested weapon, that was constructed to turn the tide in the last months of the war.

The campaign gameloop is divided into three phases: 1.: the campaign phase in which the player plot their next mission by choosing a target, upgrading their vessel, building the moral bag and promoting and training their crew. 2.: the travel phase in which the player concludes a number of random events based on the mission's destination. And 3.: the tactical combat phase in which the player concludes an encounter with their mission's target. For planning torpedo attacks, a full functional replica of a Torpedo Attack Disc is used, to triangulate attack and intercept angles.

Encounter gameplay is continued in rounds, alternating between the player and the AI, until the player withdraws from the game board, the crew of the submarine surrenders or the submarine is sunk.

The campaign game ends, when the submarine has been destroyed, the crew has surrendered or after the last mission in Mai 1945 with the end of World War II. If the crew has survived after the final mission, total VP are counted from all missions and are compared to historical results of actual "Seehund" operations.

boardgame.name: The Game of Kriss Kringle's Visits
boardgame.description:
Typical spin and move game including cards.
Each player chooses one of 4 corners of the board for his "home". The player who spun lowest spins again, and moves Kriss Kringle toward his home the number of spaces spun (each olly leaf is a space). The next player spins, and moves Kriss Kringle toward his home; and so on round and round. When the player gets Kriss Kringle either to stop at, or pass over, his home space, he takes a card from the top of the pile in the centre. The game proceeds till all the cards are used up. When all the cards are exhausted, the player who has most GIFTS wins the game.

boardgame.name: TMNT HeroClix: Shredders Return
boardgame.description:
Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles HeroClix is packed with “Turtle Power” featuring fan favorite characters including Leonardo, Donatello, Michelangelo and Raphael, along with their greatest allies and enemies.

The set contains characters from the TMNT IP. The game is played on a gridded map that is 24x36 inches. the game is played with prepainted miniatures. the goal of the game is to either defeat your opponents entire team or accumulate more points than your opponent in a timed game. Each miniature is allocated a certain number of points printed on the base of the mini.

The game plays much like a miniatures game. Most of the vital statistical information is directly on the base of the characters, which can be rotated as characters take damage from hits.
