boardgame.name: The Thwarted Course
boardgame.description:
From the designer:

Word has spread as far as Birevia—masons are needed, or those willing to learn, to repair an ancient bridge. The silver is flowing, but why is nobody returning?

The Thwarted Course is my take on a classic setup: the ogre-troubled bridge. Here, however, the ogre isn't an isolated hermit, but the penultimate link in a dreadful chain of exploitation.

boardgame.name: The Incursion Egg
boardgame.description:
From the designer:

Three years ago, a Birevian expedition set sail to solve the mystery once and for all: what lies inside the great glass dome of Never Gap? Puila's cog never returned, and the mystery remains.

This adventure started with a purely visual inspiration: a giant dome enclosing an island, far out to sea. What purpose could the dome-makers have had? What's inside?

boardgame.name: The Sequence of Deel
boardgame.description:
From the designer:

High in the hills is a village plagued by nighttime poisonings. Victims claim there is a crone who comes creeping in through windows and chimneys to smother and sting them, though none has seen her in the day. If she exists, she is but one part of the sequence of Deel.

boardgame.name: The Mouth of Spring
boardgame.description:
From the designer:

In every town, village, and hamlet are women who have seen beyond fear, who are strong enough to push back winter and bring new life to the lands. Their power comes from beneath an old, stone shrine, half-forgotten by the people of today. What secrets are known to those who dare pass through the mouth of spring?

The Mouth of Spring is flooded cavern system underneath a quiet shrine. I really wanted to have fun with changing water levels—the caverns are navigable both while empty or while draining, but the logistics are quite different in each case.

boardgame.name: Miss Furry
boardgame.description:
User Summary

Reveal (explicit) Furry images using one of the seven different game styles including rock-paper-scissor, a Jezzball style, catch-style (like in Jones on Fire), TRON style, Pac-Man style and more.

boardgame.name: The Raindrinkers
boardgame.description:
From the designer:

When clear skies suddenly turn stormy, people look for the strange wagons of the Raindrinkers sliding over the mud, collecting the rain as they go. These nomadic peoples know a terrible truth: the earth’s waters are tainted.

The Raindrinkers is a wandering encounter-style two-pager written by a longtime friend, guest writer Tim Groth. Tim locked in on the strange weapons of the Martoi*—the terrible poisons unleashed on the living by the echoes of ancient conquerors.

What would a people be like if they had made peace with the danger?

boardgame.name: The Wagoner's Table
boardgame.description:
From the designer:

The echoes of the feasting songs are fading, but winter still has many cold months in store. In the highlands villages, winter's bite is most cruel. Still, legend has it that even the most desperate can find mercy at the wagoner's table.

This wandering encounter-type adventure gave me a chance to show off a little bit more Seree infrastructure, in this case the towering tribute wagons they used to collect delicacies from outlying areas of their dominion.

boardgame.name: The Man From Before
boardgame.description:
From the designer:

A mountain village grows wealthy selling a strange and magical oil. But its prosperity is tied up in the legacy of a fateful war. Only the children know the cost of the work they do—at the bidding of the Man from Before.

I can't even explain this one. On the surface, it's a pastoral mystery, suitable for low-level adventurers. Scratch that surface and there's an extremely powerful NPC, possibly an ally or mentor. Or, maybe the players will see the dynamic as monstrously exploitative and view him as a villain. Push a little harder, and there's a campaign-wrecking bomb, just waiting to go off.

boardgame.name: Haunting of Hainsley Hall
boardgame.description:
From the designer:

Almost but not quite in time for Halloween, here's a haunted mansion! It's a whimsical twist on the haunted house: in this case, it's the ghosts that want the adventurers to help them out.

boardgame.name: His Eternal Progress
boardgame.description:
From the designer:

Emperor tortoises have walked the earth since before the rocks were cool; each is followed by a train of pilgrims hoping to glimpse the wisdom of the gods. No wizard has ever managed to capture one, not even the Seree—until Nauz, Lycaeum head necromancer found a horrid way to breach the ancient shell. But now what?

boardgame.name: Do it for the Beast
boardgame.description:
From the designer:

Then the strange man, still holding my wrist, drew his knife across the palm of my hand. Before the pain could set in, the most wondrous thing happened! A red serpent, bright as blood slithered from the wound, and rose in my hand. I was transfixed, but the strange man seemed unsurprised. "You can stay with us," he said, "or you can leave and return home. But whichever you do, you must do it for the beast."

boardgame.name: Innocent Girl
boardgame.description:
User Summary

Similar to Miss Furry, you have seven game modes (Tron, Snake, Pac-Man, Cutter/Jezzball, Catcher, Puzzle and Rock-Paper-Scissor) to unlock some explicit images of some innocent looking girls.

boardgame.name: Can't Sleep - Clowns Will Eat Me
boardgame.description:
From the designer:

The good folk of Juniper's Crossing haven't slept a wink since the circus arrived, and not for lack of trying. People are starting to see things that aren't real, and—even worse—some things that are.

boardgame.name: Mulciber's Flute
boardgame.description:
From the designer:

In the Motes of Eternity, the old world has been ploughed under, demigods and all. I've been mulling over this process - was it cataclysmic? Was it gradual? I find that fascinating, the idea that the mythic underworld was once the surface world.

Perhaps it's the regional demigods, the ancestral hosts that protect pockets of the world being lost. Maybe the mountains are hollow, each one an ancient cyst.

Either way, not all of the powers would accept their fate gracefully. Mulciber's Flute is an adventure set in hell - well, a specific kind of hell: a pocket nightmare, the sort of thing you might expect if a demigod went all Vlad the Impaler.

boardgame.name: Sirens of Sea and Blood
boardgame.description:
From the designer:

A trio of horrifying sirens lives in a twisty set of sea-side caverns. They've got a taste for man-flesh, but they're more than happy to bestow the gifts of their ocean-goddess upon any women willing to endure their violent ritual of indoctrination.

boardgame.name: My Stepmom is a Futanari
boardgame.description:
User Summary

You are Jake, a college student who decided to visit your single dad on your holiday to find out that he have met someone special; when you arrive he ask you about your blessing to marry her.
One day you end up alone with her and you find out something new about your soon-to-be stepmom...
boardgame.videogameseries: My Stepmom is a Futanari series

boardgame.name: Alchemy!: Platinum Founder's Edition
boardgame.description:
Alchemy! is a card game that turns players into competing apprentice alchemists trying to impress their master by being the first to complete a set of potions in a laboratory space they all share.

This limited-edition upgraded Kickstarter release combined the Alchemy! base game's Kickstarter edition with the Alchemy!: Famous Alchemists, Amazing Potions, & Remarkable Places expansion, plus a set of 250 card sleeves and 4 extra tuckboxes, all in a box with a limited-run slipcover (optionally signed by the game's creators).

boardgame.name: My Stepmom is a Futanari 2
boardgame.description:
User Summary

While in between jobs, your live with your wealthy, but busy father; he is away most of the time for work, leaving you alone with your stepmotehr who is a realy fury! Even your father makes sure to stay on her good side.
One day she have had enough of you and loads a bunch of chores on you - but little did you know that after this you find yourself in for a surprise!
boardgame.videogameseries: My Stepmom is a Futanari series

boardgame.name: Chilli or Chunder
boardgame.description:
As chilli eating contestants there are two things you focus on: Eating more chillies than the other contestants. The other... Not chundering!

Over five rounds of ever increasing hotness, you will eat your way through each chilli, bite by bite. You will need to keep down the bites and once the whole chilli is gone, you show your empty mouth before progressing to the next round. Or fall victim to the chilli, either by failing to take the next bite or chundering it back up.

Outlast your fellow contestants to take the crowning glory and become the Chilli or Chunder Champion!

—description from the designer
boardgame.boardgamecompilation: Chilli or Chunder: Chilli Eating Contest Game

boardgame.name: グレート・サマナー (Great Summoner)
boardgame.description:
グレート・サマナー (Great Summoner) is a 2 player strategy game from Japan. Players are wizards battling with their wits for their lands. The game box has a full title of グレート・サマナー 〜二人の偉大なる召喚術士〜 (Great Summoner ~Two Great Summoners~).

Each player has the role of a novice Summoner, and is trying to create magic circles in the opponents landscape, in order to summon a monster. If the defender can reach the circle and suppress it, the monster cannot arrive. But if it gets through, the land is damaged.

However, the game has many more elements beyond this fighting. As players are battling, they also must take a key hidden by a guard, and use it to rescue a servant. This gives clues to decide the mystery of the deadly death that can be used only once during the battle, and summon the phantom beast to aim for the opponent's capture.

This is handled in the game by various cards, giving 'keys and keyholes', six unique followers, four different tactical types, tactics that make use of the terrain, and 'mysteries and secrets'. The elements of strategy, identity concealment, and luck are combined in a game system that requires you deduce your opponent's hand whilst concealing yours.
user summary

The publisher says:
Create magic circles and summon phantoms to conquer your opponent's area! Psychological battles where players read each other and cheat each other as the board changes rapidly!

Great Summoner" is a two-player board game that features a non-stop psychological battle between players.

Players take on the role of novice summoners in a battle for the fate of their country.

The player can summon phantoms by creating magic circles in the opponent's territory.

However, the opponent can move to the square where the magic circle has been created to remove the magic circle and prevent the summoning of the beast.

It is important to read each other's cards and create magic circles in squares that your opponent cannot reach in order to summon monsters!

In addition, you can also collect keys hidden by the guards, special skill cards for your followers, and special skill cards to summon powerful monsters.

The player who can summon the most monsters wins the game.

魔法陣を生成し幻獣を召喚して相手エリアの制圧を目指せ！目まぐるしく変化する盤面に応じた読み合い騙し合いが白熱する心理バトル

『グレート・サマナー　～二人の偉大なる召喚術士～』は読み合い騙し合いのノンストップ心理バトルが展開される正体隠匿系・二人用ボードゲームです。

プレイヤーは駆け出しの召喚術士となって国の命運をかけた戦いに挑みます。

自プレイヤーは、相手の陣地内に魔法陣を生成することで、そこに幻獣を召喚することができます。

ただし、相手プレイヤーは、魔法陣が生成したマスまで移動することで、魔法陣をかき消し、幻獣の召喚を阻止することができます。

手札を読み合いながら、相手が届かないマスに上手く魔法陣を生成し、幻獣を召喚させましょう！

さらに、衛兵が隠し持った鍵の回収や、特殊スキルを持った従者カード、強力な幻獣を召喚できる奥義カードなどが、ゲームをさらに白熱させます。

より多く幻獣の召喚に成功したプレイヤーの勝利となります。

boardgame.name: JezzBall
boardgame.description:
JezzBall is a video game originally published for [videogameplatform=4977 Microsoft Windows] in 1992. The player must capture parts of a rectangular space by dividing it with horizontal or vertical lines. While each line is being drawn it must not be touched by bouncing balls. JezzBall has similarities with QIX, a 1981 arcade game.

History
JezzBall was programmed by Dima Pavlovsky and named after Jez San, a contemporary of Dima. It was published in 1992 as part of the Microsoft Entertainment Pack and later released within the Best of Microsoft Entertainment Pack. Its name is also a play on words on Jezebel.

The game was remade as a Modern UI app for Windows 8 and later by Random Salad Games, under the name "Jezzball Galaxy"

Source: Wikipedia, "JezzBall", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

boardgame.name: Soldier Kings: Austrian Succession
boardgame.description:
With the death of her father, Emperor Charles VI, in October 1740 23-year-old Maria Theresa inherited not an empire or even a country, but a collection of far-flung territories stretching from the Atlantic coast to Italy to Transylvania. The Habsburg inheritance seemed almost intentionally designed to encourage predators, with its richest territories widely separated from the “core lands” and bordering her hungriest neighbors.

For the next eight years, almost all of Europe would be engaged in war as Maria Theresa fought to retain her crowns and exert her family’s right to rule the Holy Roman Empire. France, Spain, Prussia and Sweden all lined up against her, while Britain and Russia only provided sporadic help. Despite a tiny army, weak finances and utter lack of competent generals, Maria Theresa somehow kept her empire intact.

Austrian Succession is an expansion book for Soldier Kings: Pragmatic Sanction, adding even more historical background to this unique conflict plus game variants plus scenarios for two additional wars: the 1733-1735 War of the Polish Succession and the 1735-1739 Austro-Russo-Turkish War. You get 76 new die-cut and silky-smooth playing pieces plus 16 additional tiles.

—description from the publisher
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Soldier Kings: Pragmatic Sanction – Europe at War, 1740-1748

boardgame.name: Take That Hill!
boardgame.description:
Take That Hill builds upon a previous version by Prof Phil Sabin of Kings College London. A simple hex and counter, IGO-UGO system introduces players to basic mechanics used in the majority of commercial wargames. Game-play is solo or two-player and does not require an umpire to facilitate. This makes TTH suitable for self-learning, cooperative play, or a larger seminar wargame. Advanced rules add complexity and additional realism as required by the players. whilst staying true to the base rules.

In the game, the player represents a platoon with three sections and a Platoon HQ, which must take hold of an enemy position while minimizing the time inerted as well as the loses incurred. In each turn, each unit can move or fire, unless it is spent because of enemy fire.

—description from the publisher

Flower Shoppe is a solo expansion for Tussie Mussie, consisting of Turn Cards that will determine how cards are dealt and how you must distribute cards between yourself and your opponent. Each round your opponent gets to keep a card making it harder and harder as you go.

boardgame.name: Akvárko
Fish Tank
boardgame.description: Fish Tank is a tableau-building game in which each of the players collect fish for their aquarium. Each kind of the fish has different criteria for scoring; some prefer the edges of the tank, some like to be in the middle, some like to gather together and some don’t like to have their kind around them. The players draft their fishes in 2 phases of the game, each consisting of 8 rounds. At the end of the game, each player has a 4 x 4 tableau of multicoloured fish in front of them. The player whose fish tank generates the most points is then declared the winner.

boardgame.description:
メガチェン (Megachen) is a party game from Japan. The players are running an opticians shop. Different women come in and want new glasses to suit a certain style. The players offer different frames and explain why they suit the customer's needs. Players take turns being the customer and vote with a love heart for the best offering.

boardgame.name: The Obstruction Method
boardgame.description:
From itch.io:

The Obstruction Method is a game about Frances Holden’s 1925 behaviorist experiment involving 803 albino rats—variously starved—and an electrified maze. In it you will play Holden and the people around her engaging in their own behaviorist experiment that mimics the rat maze—one dealing with issues of love, fidelity, cruelty, and ambition.

This is a live-action role playing game. You will embody your character in a way similar to improvisational theater and equally similar to tabletop role playing. Your audience are your fellow players and your goal is to generously help them have an amazing experience, trusting them to return the favor.

You will need a total of 4-6 players and about two hours. And a rubber rat.

boardgame.name: Hollow Trail
Prokletá stezka
boardgame.description:
In Hollow Trail, you become pilgrims on the long-for-gotten road to salvation. Your goal is to place cards controlled by you (servants)on selected locations and gain points. But the trail vanishes in your steps, so it´s up to you, if you´re willing to sacrifice your servants by placing them on those doomed places.

There are 4 actions in player´s turn:

Send - You’ll start every turn with 5 Minions in your hand. When you take a Send action, choose one of them and place it below the leftmost card of the trail. Mark it with a token in your color.



Travel - With a Travel action, you advance one Minion along the trail to the right. Your Minion can take a number of steps indicated by its speed



Fight - With a Fight action, you can attempt to slay or turn an opponent’s Minion. Choose one of your Minions at that same location. Your Minion is the attacker and your opponent’s Minion is the defender. Specify whether you will fight with strength or willpower.



Conjure - Each location along the Hollow Trail holds magical power that can be unleashed by those who know its secrets. To take a Conjure action, your Minion and its location must have a matching type. This type determines the type of spell you can Conjure.


Contests
Hollow trail is a positional game. To score, you need to send your Minions to a particular location. The locations that allow players to compete for points are called Contests. The Contests are not resolved until the scoring phase (every 4 rounds) so it’s not enough to gain the dominant position – you must hold it.

Scoring phase
After each set of 4 rounds, there is a scoring phase, as indicated by the timing track along the top of the scoreboard. The following things happen in this order:
1. Guardians attack. Resolve Guardians from left to right.
In the example below, the Guardian attacks the location to its left, turning the red Minion into a Lost Minion.
2. Score locations from left to right.
In the example below, the red and blue players are tied at the first location, so each gets 2 points. No one gets points at the second location. The red player could have scored 5 points at the third location, but red’s Minion was turned, so no one scores. Both players at the Campsite score 1 point.
3. Old trail vanishes! Remove the first three locations and all Minions there. Cards go to their respective discard piles. Slide all remaining cards left.
4. If any of the remaining locations is still face down, turn it face up. Guardians revealed this way do not attack, but give Guardians and Obstacles their resistance tokens and replacement-option cards, as usual.
5. New trail appears. Shuffle the deck corresponding to the next part of the game and deal out 3 new locations face down.
At the ends of part I and part II, the first three locations in the trail are removed. The Minions at those locations have a chance to glean magical essence for their players, but they don’t survive to the next part of the game. In general, it’s a good idea to get at least one Minion to the second half of the trail so you aren’t starting the next part of the game with nothing.
6. The leftmost card of the trail must not be an Obstacle or a Guardian. If it is, replace it with a random Contest from the same deck.
7. All players may now discard any number of Minions from their hands and draw back to a full hand of 5. In this case, all cards must be drawn randomly from the deck.
8. Advance the round counter and determine a new starting player. The player in the worst position gets to go last. This means the starting player is the player to the left of the one with the fewest points. If players are tied for fewest points, the one with fewer Minions is worse off. If there is still a tie, break it randomly.

boardgame.name: Makergod
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The raiders of Oghma mercilessly prey upon the blighted star systems of the Outrim Void. Their endless plundering has reduced their neighbors to pre-starflight technology.

When the travellers get caught up in an Oghman raid, they find themselves going to the raiders' homeworld, a strange and unique place where starfaring tech meets the barbarism of Ghengis Khan.

But something is happening on Oghma. Oghma has deep, dark secrets and the travellers can either help drag this savage world out of the darkness, or be swallowed up by it forever.

Includes a complete adventure, a brand-new starship, the Threshing Oar-class raider (illustrated by fan-favorite artist Ian Stead, stats, 2D and 3D deck plans), a new grav vehicle (the Doomsayer APC), world maps, character art, and graphics.

boardgame.name: Cult of Moloch
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Mystery cults are secret societies that exist within religious institutions. Like other secret societies, their existence is well known, but their rituals, lore, and objectives are concealed. Only the initiated are allowed access to these secrets.

This file provides an overview of mystery cults and specific details about the Cult of Moloch, one of the most horrible deities in the Amazons vs Valkyries setting.

Features:

Sample cult secrets
The location of Moloch's temples and shrines
Festivals and rites held in Moloch's honor
Brief history ands methods of the cult
2 New Spells (Eruption and Wildfire)
1 New Monster (flaming souls called Maliku)
1 CR 7 NPC Herald of Moloch: Izabella
Fire Domain
The Oath Immolated Souls for Moloch's paladins

boardgame.name: One Page Adventure: Gnoll Treetop Camp
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Rumors of a marauding band of gnolls has swept through the area. A scarred old man, sporting a few fresh injuries, says he has more information. He can give you the location of their camp - a system of tree structures connected with rope bridges. Better yet, he's willing to pay. All he wants in return is his locket and the head of their leader.

One Page Adventure: Gnoll Treetop Camp contains:

A short adventure for level 2 characters
An HD dungeon map
An Adventure Seed
A new Trap

boardgame.name: True Party Destiny
boardgame.description: A collectible trading card strategy game featuring art of and by community artists. Gameplay involves playing cards to a grid, flipping one or more other cards based on adjacency and relative strength, and following special instructions on the cards, vaguely similar to Equinox and the TCG mini-games from various JRPG console games. Like Othello and Equinox, the goal is to have more cards face up in your color after all cards are played.

boardgame.name: Ridley's Games Room: Brain Freeze Quiz
boardgame.description: The fast-paced word guessing game for all ages! Get your teammates to work out the secret word, but there's a catch - you can't say any of the words listed on the card. See which team can guess the most in this brain-freezing quiz set from Games Room. Perfect for gaming fun with friends and family, it includes 140 question cards. Presented in a stylish geometric print box. Full instructions included.

boardgame.name: The Balloonist (Web Enhancement)
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

In Azeroth, air transport is a luxury for a minority. Flaying mounts are expensive, and not all spellcasters are powerful enough to life their allies into the skies. Those who decide to charge for such a service demand a high price for it. There is, although, a cheaper option.

boardgame.name: The Spell Breaker (Web Enhancement)
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Elven warrior trained to disrupt and contort magical energies. These Blood Elven warriors, fresh from the destruction of their homeland, have turned a new eye towards the dying land of Lordaeron. Can it possibly remain their home?

boardgame.name: The Spell Sniper (Web Enhancement)
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

The spell sniper is the epiphany of every tinker who wished to have "more band for their buck" when using firearms.

boardgame.name: Solar Echoes Player's Guide (2E)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Solar Echoes Player's Guide 2nd Edition has been totally overhauled and filled with full-color art! Enjoy new game improvements and balances as well, such as greater weapon effects, alien racial weaknesses, full-color character and starship icons, and an improved and more rewarding dice system!

The Player's Guide is the core rule-book for Solar Echoes, the tabletop RPG with no turn-taking! Includes fast, streamlined game rules for squad combat, starship and vehicle combat, hacking, and dialogue encounters. Inside is everything a player needs to create unique characters: playable alien races, skills, a huge library of talent choices, weapons, armor, other equipment, cyberware, and much more. Information about history, astronomy, locations, and interesting organizations is provided in addition to details about starships and other vehicles players may operate in the game.

230 pages containing all the rules needed to play, including:

Full rules for squad combat, starship and vehicle combat, hacking, and dialogue encounters
7 detailed alien character races, each providing a unique gameplay experience with its own racial abilities and culture
Character customization options with a variety of skills, physiques, and personality choices
A huge library of over 270 talent choices for designing any character type you can imagine
A vast selection of weapons, armor, cyber-weapons, cyberware, and other equipment
Stats for a wide variety of starships, air and terrestrial vehicles
Historical information, location details, and unique organization descriptions
Background material for the Inter-stellar Union (ISU) and your role as a Union Guard agent
Character sheets, phase cards, starship / vehicle cards, MC sheets, grid map, starmap, and icons for characters and starships

boardgame.name: Hollow & Mosaic Trust
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Agents and operatives working for the Mosaic Trust enjoy access to a secret weapon available to no other group, organization, or company. A mission team can, from anywhere in the world, place a call by computer or phone and request the help of a brilliant adviser known only as Hollow. Regardless of the time of day or their location, the mission team can ask for information, surveillance, or tactical advice. This resource has often proven the difference between a successful mission and a failed one. Although the Mosaic Trust restricts who has access to Hollow, the corporation has allowed some of their most trusted freelancer teams to call upon this resource. Such communications cannot be traced back to the Trust in any way. Even those employed by the Trust don’t realize Hollow works for their company.

This PDF contains everything you need to know about Hollow & Mosaic Trust, in the Amazing Universe Campaign or any other superhero campaign.
boardgame.rpgseries: Official Handbook of the Amazing Universe

boardgame.name: Canine Collection
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Welcome to the sixteenth installment of Monster Mash. This installment will introduce ten canines to introduce to your campaign. Here you will find new creatures and/or new takes on old creatures for your Fantasy Hero Campaign.

This installment will include the following canines, Blink Wolf, Death Wolf, Dire Wolf, Elven Wolf, Ethereal Wolf, Ghoul Wolf, Hell Wolf, Stone Wolf, Shadow Wolf, and Winter Wolf.

Ten new canines to torture adventures and fill your realm with. Canines of every shape and size and many with unique abilities. Canines in every shape and size for GMs to use to their advantage. If this installment does ensure your campaign goes to the dogs nothing will.

boardgame.name: Fairy Hound
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

No hound Pwyll had ever seen was the color of these:
a dazzling, shining white with red ears.
— The Mabinogion

Fairy hounds are known by many names, including cu sidhe in Ireland, cu sith in Scotland, and cwn annwn in Wales. They are the guard dogs and hunting dogs of the greater faeries: those of human stature.
